result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesus Hernandez Granada

defendant.name: Hernandez Granada, Jesus
defendant.address: 1023 W Main St Apt 2E, Watertown, WI 53094

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: submitted by Attorney Dahnert at Plea/sentencing

Cases 15CM196, 15CM198 & 15CT182 called together at 9:44 am [Clerk SH] (Cases were scheduled for STC)
Defendant Jesus Hernandez Granada in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Leisl Monroy sworn as Spanish Interpreter.

15CT182: Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 & #3

On Count #1, the Court sentences the Defendant: 
--To serve 60 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence 10/2/15 by 7:00 pm 
--Days credit for time already served: 0 days
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process
--To pay fine of $350 + costs (includes $200 DNA Surcharge) = $1379; due in $50 increments per month beginning 12/15/15 and on the 15t5 day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment will result in 28 days in jail with Huber privileges, consecutive
--Revocation of drivers license for 16 months
--County alcohol/drug assessment ordered
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device requirement/restrictions for: 16 months 
--6 demerit points assessed

15CM198: Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case#15CM196

On Count#1-15CM198, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, consecutive to 15CT182, with conditions:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random drug/alcohol screening (1x/mth for 1st 3mths, thereafter per Agent)
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--To pay costs of $243
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge
--To pay $75 drug testing fee
--No contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
6 month driver license suspension, concurrent
Recess: 10:26 am

Cases 15CM196, 15CM198 and 15CT182 called at 2:34pm [mo]
Defendant Jesus Hernandez Granada does not appear in court.
Attorney Sylvie Dahnert appears in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Dahnert indicates that Mr. Granada injured himself and was unable to attend todays hearing
Atty. Dahnert indicates that she previously requested a continuance of this hearing.

DA Happ requests that the CM cases be scheduled for Trial.
15CM196 and 15CT182 are scheduled for a joint trial as they derived from the same traffic stop.
recess: 2:44pm

NEXT: (1) STC on all 3 cases on 10/2/2015 at 9:00am (2) FSSC on Cases 15CM196 & 15CT182(15CM198 to follow as STC) on 10/13/15 at 10:30am (3) Jury Trial on Cases 15CM196 & 15CT182 on 10/19 & 10/20/2015 at 8:30am(allow 2 days)

Cases 15CT182, 15CM196 & 15CM198 called together at 9:04 am [Clerk SH] (15CT182 was scheduled for FSSC)
Defendant Jesus Hernandez Granada in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Shawna Stevenoski sworn as Spanish Interpreter.

15CM196 & 15CM198:
Atty Dahnert indicates that she will be representing Mr. Hernandez Granada on these matters
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court requires a $1500 signature bond, to cover both cases, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of illegal drugs
-No possession of drug paraphernalia
-Booking

15CT182: Atty Dahnert requests this matter track with CM files, presents basis
ADA Teuber: No objection, presents basis
Court cancels trial and indicates that It will set CT matter for Status at same time as CM cases
Recess: 9:11 am   

NEXT: 15CM196 & 15CM198: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 7/29/15 at 1:20 pm - Send notices 15CM196, 15CM198 & 15CT182:(2) STC scheduled for 8/14/15 at 1:30 pm  - Send notices

Cases 15CM196 and 15CM198 called together at 11:17am [mo]
Defendant Jesus Hernandez Granada does not appear in court.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Initial Appearance scheduled in both cases.
The State requests these matters be set for the same date and time as the FSSC in case 15CT182
The Court grants this request. Cases 15CM196 and 15CM198 are to be scheduled with the FSSC in 15CT182
recess: 11:20am 

NEXT:  ON BOTH CASES: Initial Appearances on 7/7/15 at 9:00am (send notices)
